Justification: To assess hearing function and investigate the cause of tinnitus (ringing in the ears).
To evaluate for benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV), which is a common cause of dizziness triggered by changes in head position.
To rule out central causes of dizziness such as vestibular schwannoma or other intracranial pathologies.
To assess cardiac rhythm and rule out arrhythmias as a cause of dizziness.
To check for anemia, electrolyte imbalances, or hypoglycemia that could contribute to dizziness.
To evaluate for orthostatic hypotension, which can cause dizziness upon standing.
To assess the function of the vestibular system and identify any peripheral vestibular disorders.
